[Meteor-Summoning Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeteorSummoningAttack): He uses both Comet and Meteor to drop meteors on foes when summoned.

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): Found at the highest point of the Mosphoran Highwaste, accessible only after the party reaches the Phon Coast and gets water running into the shrines at the main camping area, allowing them to use the "floatweeds" to reach the higher points.
[Plant Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlantPerson): His torso looks a lot like a tree, matching the reference he embodies.
[Randomized Damage Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RandomizedDamageAttack): His Comet and Meteor deal random damage, which in meteor's case can go as high as 30,000.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Called the "Judge-Sal" for his duty of giving a value to all things in life. "Sal" is a type of tree native to Northern India.
[Wizard Beard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WizardBeard): A long white beard to show his age in comparison to his fellow Espers.
[Boss Room](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossRoom): The Womb of the Sun-Cryst atop the Pharos at Ridorana, at the height of Dr. Cid's desire to test the nethicite's power.

[Dual Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualBoss): You fight him after he's summoned by Dr. Cid to attack the party atop the Pharos. Both will attack you simultaneously, but Cid can only be defeated when Famfrit is taken out first.
[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): Two huge jars tied to his arms by chains. They can gather water and shoot it like cannons.

[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak):
    - Waterja/Aquaja as a boss, a party-wide attack that deals Water damage and has a chance of inflicting Silence. - Tsunami as a summon, an attack in which Famfrit gathers rainwater from the clouds around himself and drops the collected water from his jars into the ocean, causing a massive tidal wave that deals massive water damage to all foes in range.
[Making a Splash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash): The Esper of Water, attacking with Briny Cannonade, Waterja, and Tsunami.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): Not his name, but his title. In Japanese, he's just straight-up called the "Cloud of Darkness", which is the name of the final boss of *[Final Fantasy III](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyIII)*.

[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Called the "Darkening Cloud" due to his ability to summon storm clouds even from within his armor, and the fact that the inside of his armor is completely devoid of light.
[Sealed Evil in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan): The real Famfrit is contained within what looks like his body, which is actually a bulky, heavy suit of armor.

[Shielded Core Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShieldedCoreBoss): As long as Famfrit is active in battle, Dr. Cid will be immune to physical and magical attacks. He'll only be the main boss again and able to be harmed when his summoned Esper is defeated.

[Animal Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotifs): Has huge bull horns on his head, but otherwise serves as an aversion to the theme of rage that bulls usually invoke, especially since he sits upon a pedestal to meditate.
[Blow You Away](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlowYouAway): The Esper of Wind, who attacks with Aeroja, Whirlwind, Aeroga, and Tornado.
[Boss Room](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossRoom): The Crucible, a sealed chamber within the Necrohol of Nabudis that requires defeating the Humbaba Mistant and the Fury to open.

[Elemental Rock-Paper-Scissors](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalRockPaperScissors): In the original game, despite mastering Aero magic, Chaos has access to high-tier Fire, Lightning and Ice spells and could use them to strike at many different enemies, giving it ample elemental coverage.
[Instant Runes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstantRunes): Its Tornado has it conjure a giant mandala beneath it and jam its swords into the corners to whip up a colossal whirlwind.
[Interface Screw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterfaceScrew): His battle condition is that the party can't use the Attack command, restricting them to magics, techniques and items to deal damage.

[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak):
    - Aeroja as a boss, a party-wide wind-elemental attack that has a chance of causing Confusion. - Tornado as a summon, using the four swords around his pedestal to create a massive glyph on the ground that generates a massive tornado, dealing wind damage to all foes in the radius.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): Named after the [very first](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyI) final boss of the series, the demon Chaos, who was likewise part of an eternal time loop between his death as the fallen knight Garland and his rebirth as Chaos.

[Nerf](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Nerf): Zigzagged. Chaos in *Zodiac* loses Scourge and all of the elemental spells he had in the original game sans (naturally) Aeroga and, unlike most Espers, doesn't gain a new offensive ability. However, as with the others, he gains a massive HP and stat boost which more than make up for those.

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): Not only is he an optional Esper, he's found in a completely optional dungeon and can only be accessed by completing a sidequest that starts as early as the *fourth hunt of the game*. And not only that, you have to go out of your way to complete it, then fight two more bosses on top of that before finally reaching him.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): He died and reincarnated as he lived on, becoming the "Walker of the Wheel" (of life).

[Reincarnation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Reincarnation): Effectively immortal because of this, able to be reborn after death and having done so countless time, which is what led to his rebellion against the gods.
[Who Wants to Live Forever?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhoWantsToLiveForever): Chaos's motive for rebelling. He was made to reincarnate every time he died and found this to be a terrible existence.
[Angelic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngelicAbomination): Looks heavenly and pristine, having a very human face, but is also an opportunistic Esper with a lot of power.
[Boss Room](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossRoom): The Great Crystal's Peak, deep within Giruvegan. Ironically for her element, it's the area most devoid of light in the Great Crystal.
[HP to One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HPToOne): A variation; Holyja can inflict Reverse on the party, and Ultima will then cast Renew on those afflicted and reduce their HP to 1.

[Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination): She looks the most human out of all the Espers, but is still eternally holding up her dress, has huge golden wings and the rest of her body includes a large metal base with spinning blades underneath that helps her float above the ground.

[Interface Screw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterfaceScrew): When her health drops a certain amount, she'll cast a field that will change the limitations of the battle to that of previous Espers and other bosses, including a new one that drains the party's MP.

[Kill Sat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillSat): Ultima's [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) animation shows her doing this [if you can get her to use it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuideDangIt).
[The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader): Of the Espers' rebellion against the gods.

[Light 'em Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightEmUp): The Esper of Holy. She uses Holy and Holyja when fought and has a unique ability called Redemption. As a summon, she can use the limit break Eschaton.

[Light Is Not Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsNotGood): An Esper that looks like an angel and has control over light, yet is a vile being that attacks the party without provocation when she's met.

[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak):
    - Holyja as a boss, which causes the Reverse status on the party. - Eschaton as a summon, an attack where Ultima flies high into space and fires a Holy-elemental laser down to the Earth, dealing massive Holy damage to all enemies nearby.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): Named for and themed after the leader of the Lucavi from fellow Ivalice Alliance game [Final Fantasy Tactics](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyTactics).

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): Can only be reached after the main plot in Giruvegan is done, which opens up [the rest of the Great Crystal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalBonusLevel) for exploration.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Called "The High Seraph" for her glimmering wings and her duty to take men's souls into Heaven.

[Satanic Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SatanicArchetype): Ultima is a [Fallen Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FallenAngel) who led the Espers' rebellion against the gods (the Occurria) and, as a result, was sealed and forced to guard the Great Crystal.
[Angelic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngelicAbomination): His mature form. About 80% of his body is just *wings*.

[Begin with a Finisher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeginWithAFinisher): His first move in combat is to cast Darkja, a powerful [dark-elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastingAShadow) attack that hits the whole party and has a substantial chance to inflict Blindness and *Instant Death*.
[Boss Room](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossRoom): Special Charter Dig, deep in the Henne Mines.
[Cap](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Cap): In *Tactics A2*, summoning Zodiark has a 50% chance of dealing 999 damage to each unit on both sides.

[Casting a Shadow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastingAShadow): The Esper of Dark. The element is instead given to Zalera in *Revenant Wings* and *Tactics A2*. In *XII*, however, his unique ability Banish Ray is dark-elemental and he uses Darkja when fought.
[Feathered Serpent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FeatheredSerpent): His adult stage.

[Fixed Damage Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FixedDamageAttack): Zodiark's [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) does exactly 50,000 damage (60,000 damage in the Zodiac versions). Summoning Zodiark in *Tactics A2* has a 50% chance of hitting each unit on both sides for 999 damage.

[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak):
    - Darkja as a boss, a party-wide dark-elemental attack that inflicts Blind and has a 50% chance of inflicting instant KO, 25% with the right equipment on. - Final Eclipse as a summon, a non-elemental move where Zodiark enters his mature stage and creates a world-destroying cataclysm, dealing exactly 50.000 (60.000 in *Zodiac*) damage.
[Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental): Unlike the other elemental Espers, Zodiark's limit break, Final Eclipse, is non-elemental.

[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): Zodiark's Darkja ability inflicts this in addition to blind to the entire party. It's less likely to take effect than the blind effect, but there's nothing that grants you immunity to it.

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): Only available when the player has at least 10 Espers defeated and enlisted, in a part of the Henne Mines that can only be opened once Geomancer Yugelu recognizes the party's abilities.

[Pint-Sized Powerhouse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PintSizedPowerhouse): Zodiark is the smallest of the Espers, but easily one of the hardest bosses in the game and the most powerful Esper. In fact, his power was the exact reason his creators sealed him away.

[Power Gives You Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerGivesYouWings): Zodiark has twelve of them during his [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) and keeps them during *Revenant Wings*. They're so big that you can barely see his actual body in the center.
[Power of the Void](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerOfTheVoid): Zodiark's [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) involves him blasting a hole in spacetime itself.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Called the "Keeper of Precepts" for maintaining the Occuria's order in their stead.
[Snakes Are Sinister](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnakesAreSinister): Befitting Ophiuchus, the 13th sign, Zodiark resembles a snake with wings.

[Superboss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Superboss): Although not on the same level as Yiazmat, he is nonetheless an extremely tough boss on his own, with attacks that can easily wipe out a party which would have no trouble taking on the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss).
[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Just one of Vaan's friends in the original game, and now a party member.
[Cheerful Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CheerfulChild): Just look at her quote for an example. She's a very cheerful young girl.
[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): Like Penelo before her, she gets kidnapped by Ba'Gamnan, but is quickly rescued.
[Fragile Speedster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FragileSpeedster): She moves across the map quickly and has speed-related buffs, but she can go down fast if enemies gang up on her.

[Goggles Do Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GogglesDoNothing): She wears goggles on her head that she never puts on. It might be useful for sky pirates but we never see any other sky pirates wearing them.
[Gold Fever](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldFever): Out of everyone in the party she is the most focused on the treasure hunting aspect of sky pirating.
[Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded): Filo is very outgoing and likely to jump right into the action.
[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): She fights using a Skybandit, a *hovering surfboard*.
[Jumped at the Call](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JumpedAtTheCall): She eagerly jumps at adventure and the opportunity to find treasure, just as excited about becoming a sky pirate as Vaan used to be.
[Kid Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KidSidekick): In *Revenant Wings*, she serves as one to Vaan.
[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): Her Quickening is Wind Soul, which hastens all allies and allows them to act immediately.
[Little Miss Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittleMissBadass): She's only eleven years old in *Revenant Wings*, yet is more than able to hold her own in battle.
[Precocious Crush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecociousCrush): A conversation Vaan can have with her after a chapter where they're shipwrecked reveals that she has one directed at Llyud.
[Trap Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrapMaster): Her Job relies on her setting traps to lower enemy stats.
[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): From a bit-player supporting character to party member.
[Black Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage): His job class, and he specializes in offensive magic for it.
[Cheerful Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CheerfulChild): Despite his constant worrying he is pretty upbeat and outgoing.
[Child Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildMage): He's only *10*.

[Cowardly Lion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CowardlyLion): He's the most prone to being afraid and running off, but he eventually learns from Llyud that bravery is not the absence of fear and he eventually overcomes it.

[Elemental Powers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPowers): Naturally, as a Black Mage his spells are mostly elemental. He starts off with a [fire nature and learns Firaga at level 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire), but he eventually gets [Blizzaga](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson), [Bio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PoisonousPerson), [Thundaga](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe), [Stonega](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt), and [Flare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental).

[Jumped at the Call](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JumpedAtTheCall): Like Filo, but he's a little more reserved about it. Regardless, he's still excited about the possibility of finding treasure and what it means to be a sky pirate. He's just more contemplative about it than she is.
[Kid Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KidSidekick): In *Revenant Wings*, he serves as one to Vaan.
[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): His Quickening is Nature's Wrath, which does damage a random element to all foes.
[Magic Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicStaff): His primary weapon.
[Nervous Wreck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NervousWreck): Downplayed. He's constantly worried about the situation and often asks Vaan or Penelo for reassurance.
[You Don't Look Like You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouDontLookLikeYou): He looks far different in *Revenant Wings* than he does in *XII*.
[Cast from Hit Points](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastFromHitPoints): His Revive and Transfusion both require him to sacrifice some of his HP, but he can drain it right back with Lancet.
[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): He's a Dragoon, so of course, he can Jump.

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): A visual one to [Canopus Wolph](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/TacticsOgre). Helps that both *Final Fantasy XII* and *Tactics Ogre* have [the same creator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/YasumiMatsuno).

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): He does the [Taking the Bullet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingTheBullet) version for Vaan near the end of the story, which gets his [anima drained again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmptyShell) - all at once this time - after he spent most of the game gaining it.  (SPOILER)  He gets it back after Feolthanos is defeated .
[Life Drain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LifeDrain): One of his abilities is the Dragoon's trademark Lancet.
[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): His Quickening is Fanfare, which empowers all Yarhi in the party.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): As a native to Lemurés he is often the one who tells the party about the sky continent, the aegyl, and auracite.

tropeName: My Species Doth Protest Too Much
tropeNotes: [My Species Doth Protest Too Much](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MySpeciesDothProtestTooMuch): Unlike the rest of his species, he actually is curious about human emotions.
[The Spock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSpock): Very unemotional and logical, especially contrasting with the other *Revenant Wings* newbies Kytes and Filo.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): Along with the rest of his race, for [unpleasant reasons.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmptyShell)

[Support Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportPartyMember): In addition to Jump, he actually gets several healing and support abilities like Revive (gotten much earlier than [Penelo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMage) gets it), Transfusion (healing a party member at the expense of his own HP), and [Vanishga](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Invisibility). His [Quickening](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), Fanfare, is also a supportive ability.
[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): He doesn't wear a shirt, and all his armor pieces are actually the medallions he wears around his neck.

tropeName: What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?
tropeNotes: [What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatIsThisThingYouCallLove): He has trouble understanding any feelings that the other races feel and often questions Vaan about it. When Fran goes onto the *Galbana* he wonders if she is like him, but Vaan explains she is just [The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic).
[Winged Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WingedHumanoid): Like all Aegyl.

[Captain's Log](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CaptainsLog): He's not the captain of the *Galbana* but it otherwise applies. When Penelo urges the party to keep a log of their adventures, he's the one who takes to it the most and finds some unexpected enjoyment out of it. When they get shipwrecked, he also catalogues the days that pass until he fixes up the ship again.

[Casanova Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CasanovaWannabe): He raises a suggestive eyebrow toward Fran in the first game, and tries approaching her in *Revenant Wings*, but has no luck. He later considers approaching even Ashe, but never actually does.

[Dude, Where's My Respect?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeWheresMyRespect): Every time he does something for the party by outfitting the airship with a new feature, he asks for some respect or gratitude but everyone dismisses it as him being only in it for the money. Cu Sith is the only one who gives him any.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): He's the sort to look out for himself, but he does go sick with worry when  (SPOILER)  Vaan and the others disappear into the World of Illusions after the second auracite is destroyed . By the end of the game he's also more openly friendly.

[Kid With The Remote Control](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KidWithTheRemoteControl): After the party knocks Ba'Gamnan out once during *Revenant Wings*, Tomaj fits a restraining collar around the Bangaa's neck, leading to some [Teeth-Clenched Teamwork](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeethClenchedTeamwork) for a few chapters until he escapes Tomaj's control.

[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): He teaches Vaan about hunt marks in *XII* and even offers him his first hunt, the Rogue Tomato. He knows so much about hunts because it turns out he is a secret member of Clan Centurio.
[Non-Action Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonActionGuy): All he ever does is manage sidequests and ship maintenance, rather than direct combat.

[No Hero Discount](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoHeroDiscount): He runs the Sky Saloon, which is the *Galbana*'s shopping area. While Vaan does try to object to not getting a discount, it's revealed that Tomaj is actually taking losses since he's selling weapons and armor that "would make Draklor Laboratory jealous." Eventually, with certain side quests completed, he does give discounts to the party once profits start rolling in.

tropeName: Only in It for the Money
tropeNotes: [Only in It for the Money](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyInItForTheMoney): He's very profit-minded, and even Vaan has doubts whenever he claims to be doing something out of kindness.

[Vitriolic Best Buds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VitriolicBestBuds): With Vaan. In one of his logs he outright states that he doesn't like Vaan, and it seems to be mutual. However, the two of them help each other out a lot and Tomaj found himself tagging along on the adventure regardless.

[The Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBlacksmith): The *Galbana*'s Master Artificer who forges weapons for the party. She's also an [Ultimate Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UltimateBlacksmith) since she makes all sorts of magic weapons from rare materials.
[Item Crafting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItemCrafting): Her main purpose, using materials foraged from battles.

[Precocious Crush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecociousCrush): Sometimes, when forging a weapon for Filo, the questions she asks Vaan are about if she'd look cute with Filo's earring and if Vaan finds her (Cu) attractive, followed by some hyperventilation.
[The Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRival): To Nono, Balthier's moogle mechanic.

[Secret Test of Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretTestOfCharacter): Whenever she forges a weapon for Vaan's party, she asks a series of often-tangential questions, which actually impact the stats of the finished product.
[Brainwashed and Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainwashedAndCrazy):  (SPOILER) Thanks to Feolthanos, her mind is not her own and she causes chaos over Ivalice.
[Break the Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakTheCutie):  (SPOILER) The results of Velis' death were... not good for her sanity.

[Broken Bird](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenBird):  (SPOILER) After Velis' death, she was heartbroken enough to let Feolthanos manipulate her into causing various tragedies, in the hope that he would grant her wish of bringing Velis back to life .
[Death Equals Redemption](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathEqualsRedemption): She finds peace and redemption when she's killed.
[The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon):  (SPOILER) To Feolthanos.
[Half-Human Hybrid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HalfHumanHybrid):  (SPOILER) She is Mydia, the last of the Feol Viera, a subspecies born from the union between aegyl and Viera.
[The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy): She is the main driver of the plot in her quest to take the auracite.
[Interspecies Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterspeciesRomance):  (SPOILER) She's an Aegyl-Viera hybrid that was in love with Velis, a Hume .

[Knight of Cerebus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightOfCerebus): The plot and everyone around her abruptly gets serious and high-stakes whenever she shows up. Her introduction changed the tone from a lighthearted adventure story to a struggle to save an entire race.
[Last of His Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHisKind):  (SPOILER) Her own actions while under Feolthanos' control doom the rest of her race, the Feol Viera.
[Love Makes You Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveMakesYouEvil): The loss of her love sparked a chain of events that led her to villainy.
[Tragic Dream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TragicDream):  (SPOILER) The only thing she wanted was to revive Velis, and look what the results were .
[Tin Tyrant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TinTyrant): Wears an imposing suit of winged armor.
[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn):  (SPOILER) Her emotions were manipulated by Feolthanos until she fell completely under his control .
[Walking Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSpoiler): As you may have noticed.
[Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoobieDestroyerOfWorlds):  (SPOILER) Sure she committed horrible atrocities, but you have to feel at least *a little* sympathy for her .
[Dead All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadAllAlong): He's actually a specter of himself in life.

tropeName: Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairOfGoldHeartOfGold): Is a typical [Knight In Shining Armour](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInShiningArmour) fighting for the girl and his country.
[Replacement Goldfish](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReplacementGoldfish): Of Penelo's older brothers.
[A God Am I](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AGodAmI): Considers himself the God of the aegyl.
[Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad):  (SPOILER) He manipulates the Judge of Wings and is the true antagonist of the game.
[Emotion Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmotionEater):  (SPOILER) He eats the Anima of his people and all who use the Auracite to become more powerful.
[God Is Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodIsEvil):  (SPOILER) For a certain value of "god."
[Immortality Immorality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImmortalityImmorality):  (SPOILER) His immortality has entirely detached him from any sense of morals.
[Interspecies Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterspeciesRomance):  (SPOILER) He and an unnamed viera woman are the ancestors of the Feol Viera.

[Master of Illusion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfIllusion): He can make Yarhi take the form of others, such as Velis and one last battle for the party against Mydia,  (SPOILER)  even after she's gone .
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel):  (SPOILER) Transforms into Feolthanos Exultant for the final battle.
[Winged Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WingedHumanoid): As an aegyl, he has a large pair of wings.
